item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The formula is (X2)*100, where X is the Level you're trying to reach.

So, say, from 19 -> 20 is (202)*100, or 400*100, i.e. 40,000.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I just found out that looping WHILE YOU HAVE A CON RUNNING does NOT aftect said con. Looping HAS NO EFFECT on billycon. Further proof it is disconnected to the reality of the billyverse?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: For what its worth, the days you play are ENTIRELY based off dayrolls, despite what it says. Friday morning at 2:49 AM, and I CANNOT enter the con. Based on Dayrolls, despite flavor text.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: In certain panels, especially those in panel 3, if you do really well (usually 3 or 4+ successes), in the reward listing for the panel, in addition to the exp, you'll see things like, "1 5% Party House Discount", or "2 11% chance for a Manly Apron". Basically, you get these various rewards, ranging from extra stamina/appetite, to decreased PH costs, to even the shinies, the BillyCon Emblem and Manly Apron. It takes 1 use of them to activate them, up to the first 3 in a day. After that, it takes 2 uses, etc. It explains how many uses it'll take on the actual rewards page. Note: Most awards/rewards are a definite. But the billycon emblem/manly apron ones have only an 11% chance of success when activating them. If you fail, you still lose the perk, and it counts as the use for the day. So, yeahâ€¦the apron and emblem are a pain to get. But highly worth it. The apron gives random ally drops, and the emblem is another +1 range. The rewards can be activated on any day, regardless of if the con's going on, or if you're in it or not. So, just level up your skills, do really well at the Con, and it pays! The +app ones are nice if you're juuuust short of that extra TACO.

item.title: Question
item.content:encoded: I noticed there's some sort of rewards program for after-con. what kind of rewards are we talking about, that we can then activate after the con, or whenever there's no con in session or whatever? To understand what i'm getting at, go to the con page. You'll see an optionâ€” "Activate Con Rewards." Explain this!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Front Row is an effect that lowers the difficulty of the next regular panel/video by 2, stacking. Available only from wandering.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ren Po Ken: We do. It isn't as noticable but from the main page, scroll down to 'events' and i believe the first line of text has the link to the dealers room (which happens to be http://bvs.wikidot.com/billycon:dealer-s-room). The link to the dealers room can also be found in the description of 'stufs' (as of this posting) and in the main nav bar on top (under Village>BillyCon). I've also been trying to tag all of the BillyCon related pages with a BillyCon tag so if you are on one of those pages, you can scroll down to the tags line at the bottom of the page and click on "BillyCon" to go to a page which lists all the pages that has the tag BillyCon on it. As of this moment, I believe I've tagged all the main billycon related pages.

So, 100 exp for lvl 1, 400 for lvl 2 (both confirmed), 900 for lvl 3, etc. If anyone has at least level 2 in a stat, please confirm.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
You've got it right, jim.

On the last day keep an eye out for Blankie (Size 1 Stuffs, +2 Sleep overnight. 5 Monies and Super Rare, as I understand it) and Extra Suitcase (+4 Packing, 12 Monies).

And Fond Memories gives you +1 Cool for the next Con.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Stuffs are permanent and don't go away, however they have to be Packed, and space is limited. (Though there is at least 1 Stuffs that increases how much you can pack)

Most give permanent effects, but some give single-use effects like Energy Drinks (which works like the Extra Noms/Clothes) or the Credit Card (which can be used to bank Monies for a later con, or retrieve said Monies).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Okay, so in the dealer's room, we have stuffs, which you keep from con to con, things, which you can use at that con only, then they go poof at the end of the con, immediate one-time-use bonuses, and items, which are used outside of the consâ€¦correct?

Also, for the case of energy drinksâ€¦unlimited uses, one-time use, or somewhere in between? I'm assuming the glowsticks are unlimited, since, well, it says soâ€¦

item.title: Some things
item.content:encoded:
Just listing things I find that aren't on the pageâ€¦

Bootleg DVD 3M
(+1 Drama XP)
Hyuk Cosplay Piece 5M
(Body Piece: 1d7+1 Full Combo Bonus: 2d7+1)

Didn't think to look before I did the Cosplay, but BillyIdolâ€¦ Also, I am r00t rank so this text might be different for those that aren't r00t.

You file into a big auditorium, and wait for the show to start. Soon enough, the light dims, and cheers and glowsticks rise aas the MikuMiku Douga appear in a flash of energy! Dressed in technological-looking, near identical clothing, differentiated only by hue, they march as one to center stage! Cheering, happy waving, and idols and fans jumping around fill the hall, as the leader of them, a skinny girl with long green hair, struts forward, grabs her microphone, and raises her hand for silence, and begins to singâ€¦

â€¦and your eyes widen as her voice strikes that perfect, hypnotic note - A in C Major - that you've heard in the Fields! You stuggle to rise from your seat, but the forced shift weakens you, and the hypnosis takes hold..

(Continue link)

You snap out of your reverie, and everyone else groggily applauds, so you join in.

You feel pretty relaxed, and everyone seemed to enjoy it, as the MikuMiku bow and leave the stage. Something is missing, though you can't determine exactly what..

+6 Sleep! +1 Cool!

Your Current Themes have been deactivated!

(as you complete other Main Events successfully, maybe something different will happen here!)

(Return to the Con link)

BillyIdol (non-r00t)

Everything is the same, you just don't realize what is being sung. Same outcome.

Rave

Music pounds from a large, darkened arena, and the room is packed with an undulating mass of dancing Ninja - and being Ninja, they know what they are doingâ€¦

Welcome to the Rave! There's a number of things to do here - from Glowslinging duels to finding love, but to do that, you'll have to get noticed - and the way to do that is to get your groove on!

Choose an Event! Only Dance starts unlocked, but others will unlock as you get better at the Rave!

Rave Event Choices

Dance - Party on!
(impress the crowds with your excellent moves! As you fill your Excellence Meter with dancing - which costs Sleep - you'll unlock bonuses, shinies, and other things to do!)

there is also a box that allows you to exit the rave with no bonuses
